text: I'm super excited about tomorrow's NY Tech Meetup; I'll be interviewing Dan Bricklin (@danb), one of my heroes. http://bit.ly/nytmdanb
Bill Maher's interview with Jay-Z shows an incredibly introspective, even shy side of Jay. Mesmerizing to watch. http://bit.ly/jzmaher
I was ruminating a bit on the fact that we love to hate our tech pundits, and speculating as to why we do: http://bit.ly/pundits
Apple's Mac OS update changed the way they count gigabytes: http://bit.ly/gbvsgib (So *that*'s where all that free disk space came from!)
The Detroit mixes of Marvin's "What's Going On" are always a disarming combo of extremely familiar and totally new: http://bit.ly/wgode
One great thing about blogging for myself is that, if I don't have anything to say, there's no pressure to put out a big post this week.
@dylan20 No way! Good tech journos will do *better* covering meaningful uses for gadgets, instead of just new press releases. #lastyears
The @whitehouse just replied to a question from a regular guy with 2 Twitter followers. There's something profound about that.
Mixtape Maestro has a wonderful remembrance of Aaliyah. (Can't believe it's been 8 years.) http://bit.ly/mmaa
It seems like YouTube subtly tweaks the design of their pages almost every day. Is anybody tracking that on a UI blog somewhere?
Many are quoting @gruber: "good blogging is just good writing" but I'm not sure that's true today. It's writing & social skills & more...
Who would you consider the most skillful practitioners of the art of blogging? (Bonus q: Why don't we talk more about blogging as a skill?)
Sure, it sucked when Evite's misery was the only way to coordinate people. But now we have a dozen replacements that all suck differently.
Playing (sanctioned) hooky with a bunch of @sixapart peeps to go watch a Mets game and roast in the sun was a good call.
@photomatt I see it more like SF is iPhone (no buttons!) and NYC is BlackBerry (we gave the dollar sign its own button!). LA is a Sidekick.
I have a nice pair of Grado headphones with absolutely terrible foam earpieces -- anybody have suggestions for replacements?
Two things I love helping people edit, even though most poeple hate doing it: Resumes and press releases.
The BBC's Technology blog's @maggieshiels has a nice story on Startup.gov, with some quotes from me: http://bit.ly/bbcgov2
So far today @SteveStreza has threatened me with violence and @tewha has said he hates me. That's odd. You guys need a hug?
Healthcare reformers could retake the conversation by simply telling 3 really tragic stories from photogenic victims of our current system.
I think I am the only kid on the block with a New Jack Hustler ringtone on his phone. Thanks, @finallevel!
startup.gov is on a roll: FCC is at @fccdotgov and has a new blog for the broadband initiative at http://blog.broadband.gov/
Hapless PR person kicked off a raging reply-all storm that's ravaging my inbox hours later. I don't much care, but I suspect her client will
Your reactions are interesting -- I don't drink coffee either, no it's not religious, and I love Tumblr, I just think GIANT FONTS are funny.
The bad/good thing about the fact I don't drink, smoke or do drugs is that I can't blame my eccentricities on anyone but myself.
Also @tumblr HALP! I am trying to sign in at http://www.tumblr.com/login but I can't find the login form? Maybe the font is too small?
Excuse me, @kickstarter, is it inappropriate to start a campaign to buy @merlinmann a comb? It's for the good of the web!
Federal News Radio interviewed me about the US Gov't being startup of the year. Listen on 1500 AM in DC or here: http://bit.ly/gov2fnr
People are still wearing their circa-1989 Batman logo shirts from last summer; Does that mean next year kids will be wearing X hats again?
Confused re: Shah Rukh Khan? Imagine detaining Conan for having the last name O'Brien. On St. Patrick's Day. And he was 20x as famous.
Mmm, we're having shrimp for dinner. It's like a socialized death panel for crustaceans in here. Obamacare seasoned with Old Bay. Delicious.
Solving my SXSW conundrum the same way I do every year: I'm not voting for *anybody's* panels, you bastards. :P
Time uses my term "kitty pidgin" in a nicely respectful article on @benhuh's success with I Can Has Cheeseburger: http://bit.ly/timeichc
The blimp floating next to the Empire State Building looks like something from a postcard. Wish they'd done that when I worked there.
This Week in Google just went up at http://twit.tv/twig3 and I got to sit in with @ginatrapani @leolaporte and @jeffjarvis. What fun!
Amadeus, one of my favorite movies, is a full 20 minutes longer in the director's cut. Surprisingly, the added minutes are worthwhile.
Aw, just dropped my iPod touch and the screen is all shattered. Still works, though.
(And if you've been enjoying my posts lately, please vote for this last essay here: http://bit.ly/usabuzz Thanks!)
This week's essay is up: My take on the most interesting new tech startup of 2009. (It's not what you think.) http://bit.ly/startupusa
Michael @Ruhlman gets to the heart of why you should grind your own burgers: It's the fat. Mmm, fat. http://bit.ly/burgerfat
"UsefulAirline is now following you." Somebody out there ain't sleeping. ;)
I wish, instead of following @jetblue and @virginamerica, someone would curate the best of both with @usefulairline or whatever.
Is there a "Replace Friday" instead of "Follow Friday"? I don't want to follow more people but I'd be open to improving my current list.
I let the cat out of the bag. No, literally, we had an appointment at the vet, and then afterwards I had to let the cat out of the carrier.
@gruber @blam You guys are both smart writers who get the kind of scoops that give our medium credibility. So stop acting like children.
Since I've been blogging 2000+ word pieces again, my RSS subscribers have been growing faster than my Twitter followers. Real writing wins?
In all seriousness, the 1st questions to ask when troubleshooting tech: Is it turned on? Is it plugged in? Solves 50% of all problems.
Step two in any attempt at troubleshooting difficult technical problems should be "go for a long walk with the dog".
Sad and embarrassing to see @TheRealDvorak reveal himself as a Vivek Kundra birther. John: Facts are your friends. You fucked up. Admit it.
Holy cow does the crew at @seriouseats know how to chow down. The waitstaff are in disbelief that a single table could order so much food.
(It's funnier if you picture me saying "I'll Bing your tweets" in an Indian accent.)
Why, no, I don't mind if you Bing my tweets. You wouldn't be the first.
I just made a pledge to @dollarshort's "Sew Better. Sew Fast. Sew Helpful." campaign on @kickstarter. You should too! http://bit.ly/3UuBZ
The nice folks at @big_think have just posted the video interviews I did with them a few weeks ago: http://bigthink.com/anildash
@textfiles I welcome criticism of my writing, but a gratuitous personal slam from you would be a bummer because I admire your work.
Some problems can only be solved by a really good horn section.
@baratunde is about to blow up the Science Channel with #FutureOf and @popsci. So proud of that guy. :)
And oh yeah, for future reference: http://www.indiansareasian.com/ The address says it all: Indians are Asian.
Delighted to have a Pearl Jam song on continuous repeat for the first time in ages. Hooray for The Fixer: http://pearljam.com/music
I still genuinely don't understand how it's legal to sell "homeopathic" products. At best they should have a "This is a placebo." warning.
This weekend's cooking is about testing mastery of the basics. Yesterday, pizza (50% success) and today, steak.
Has anybody hacked. An Android phone so that it appears as an iPhone the way the Palm Pre does?
@davewiner I'm a big Andy Rooney fan. People don't know his groundbreaking reporting on race, etc. I think blogging owes him a lot.
@mranalytical You're right that a lot of commenters disagree with my take on Wave, but I haven't found one who's actually *used* it.
This week's essay is up - I'm talking about the Web way vs. the Wave way, and what works: http://bit.ly/webvswave
Ben Zimmer in the NYT Magazine weighs in on FAIL, quoting my "End of Fail" piece in his On Language column: http://bit.ly/nytunfail
Realizing I'm pretty much never happier than when we're sitting around a table with half a dozen good friends, eating piles of yummy food.
@cjoh I have done the bicoastal Shake Shack and In-n-Out in the same day, and Shack wins. Shack also beats 5 Guys, btw.
Web 2.0 Expo NYC registration is open, and you should go because I'm gonna be speaking: http://bit.ly/w2enyc
Last night at dinner everyone was clowning me for saying PM Dawn were quiet geniuses. @tourex @sashafrerejones @maura I'm right, right?
Everyone's praising Netflix company culture: http://bit.ly/netflixculture But why does their culture yield all those shitty popup ads?
Owner of an East Village bar derided as a "frathole" asks for constructive feedback via blog comments. And succeeds: http://bit.ly/aand8s
Looking forward to @questlove, Chuck D, et. al at the Planet Hip Hop event tonight. Anyone else going? http://bit.ly/planethiphop
I had fun doing the Bad Hair Day podcast with @davewiner and @marshallk talking about Pushbutton, etc.: http://bit.ly/badhair6 #pshb
Getting ready to talk about http://lastyearsmodel.org/ to BBC Radio 5 @tweetallnight: http://bit.ly/5liveallnite #lastyears
I've heard people mention "faxing" things three times today. Clearly this is a hot new communication trend.
We made whipped cream the hard way, whisking by hand. Still, I'm pretty sure we didn't work off enough calories to offset eating it all. :)
Note to self: It's only okay to put off doing the dishes until 3am if you don't drop a giant metal pot while the spouse is trying to sleep.
